Single Pole Rocker Switches.definition: Single pole decorator/rocker style switches with paddle operation, e.g. standard single pole rocker switches, decorator paddle switches

Three Way Rocker Switches.definition: Three-way decorator/rocker style switches for multi-location control, e.g. three-way rocker switches, three-way decorator switches

Four Way Rocker Switches.definition: Four-way decorator/rocker style switches for multi-location control, e.g. four-way rocker switches, four-way decorator switches

Single Pole Toggle Switches.definition: Single pole traditional toggle style switches, e.g. standard toggle switches, grounding toggle switches

Three Way Toggle Switches.definition: Three-way traditional toggle style switches for multi-location control, e.g. three-way toggle switches

Four Way Toggle Switches.definition: Four-way traditional toggle style switches for multi-location control, e.g. four-way toggle switches

Duplex Rocker Switches.definition: Rocker switches with multiple individual switches in one device, e.g. duplex rocker switches, combination decorator switches

High Amperage Rocker Switches.definition: Rocker switches rated for 20 amp or higher current loads, e.g. 20 amp rocker switches, commercial grade high current switches

Motion Sensor Switches.definition: Switches with built-in motion detection for automatic operation, e.g. motion sensor switches, occupancy sensor switches

Illuminated Switches.definition: Switches with built-in LED indicators or pilot lights, e.g. LED illuminated switches, pilot light switches

Smart Switches.definition: WiFi or Bluetooth enabled switches for remote control and automation, e.g. smart light switches, connected switches

Wireless Remote Switches.definition: RF remote controlled switches without hardwired connections, e.g. wireless remote switches, RF controlled switches

Single Pole Toggle Switches.definition: Single pole toggle switches with traditional flip-style actuators for basic on/off lighting control, e.g. standard toggle switches, illuminated toggle switches, heavy duty toggle switches

Single Pole Rocker Switches.definition: Single pole rocker switches with paddle-style actuators for basic on/off lighting control, e.g. decorator rocker switches, paddle switches, quiet rocker switches

Three Way Switches.definition: Three way switches that allow control of lighting from two different locations, e.g. rocker three way switches, toggle three way switches, decorator three way switches

Four Way Switches.definition: Four way switches that work with three way switches to control lighting from three or more locations, e.g. decorator four way switches, paddle four way switches

Combination Switches.definition: Switches that combine multiple switching functions in a single device, e.g. dual rocker switches, triple rocker switches, duplex combination switches

Smart Switches.definition: WiFi-enabled switches that can be controlled remotely via smartphone apps or voice assistants, e.g. WiFi light switches, smart rocker switches, app-controlled switches

Illuminated Switches.definition: Switches with built-in LED indicators or locator lights for visibility in dark conditions, e.g. lighted rocker switches, LED indicator switches, night light switches

Switch Outlet Combinations.definition: Devices that combine a light switch with an electrical outlet in a single unit, e.g. toggle switch outlet combos, rocker switch receptacle combinations

Inline Cord Switches.definition: Switches designed to be installed inline with electrical cords for appliance control, e.g. cord line switches, appliance inline switches, lamp cord switches
